intro: Eronema robinsonii, commonly known as the Robinson's eronema, is a shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, white flowers. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in coastal and subalpine regions, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
